text: Prince Franz Josef of Liechtenstein (Franz Josef Wenceslaus Georg Maria; 19 November 1962 – 28 February 1991), popularly known as Prince Wenzel, was a member of Liechtenstein princely family. He was the youngest son of Franz Joseph II, Prince of Liechtenstein and his wife Georgina von Wilczek, and thus younger brother of Hans-Adam II, Prince of Liechtenstein. == Biography == He was born on 19 November 1962, as the youngest son of the former reigning Prince Franz Joseph II and the youngest brother of the current reigning Prince Hans-Adam II. His mother was Countess Georgina of Wilczek. To his family, and the Liechtensteiner general public, he was known as "Wenzel". In 1982 Prince Franz Josef "Wenzel" entered the Royal Military Academy Sandhurst, and a year later was a lieutenant in the Grenadier Guards in London. He then studied medicine at the University of Fribourg and the University of Zürich.Necrológicas. Príncipe Wenzel de Liechtenstein He worked as an assistant doctor at the Rorschach Hospital. Suddenly and quite unexpectedly, Prince Wenzel of Liechtenstein died on 28 February 1991 in the guesthouse of Vaduz Castle. ==Titles, styles and honours== ===Titles and styles=== *19 November 1962 – 28 February 1991: His Serene Highness Prince Franz Josef Wenceslaus Georg Maria of Liechtenstein === Honours === ==== National honours ==== * : Recipient of the 70th Birthday Medal of Prince Franz Joseph II.Military Collection. coleccionesmilitares.com. ==Ancestry== == References == Category:1962 births Category:1991 deaths Category:Princes of Liechtenstein Category:Graduates of the Royal Military Academy Sandhurst Category:University of Fribourg alumni Category:Liechtenstein Roman Catholics
title: Prince Franz Josef of Liechtenstein (1962–1991)
